{{Infobox radio station | name = WKOY | image = [[Image:WKOY WKQY 2009.PNG|200px]] | city = [[Princeton, West Virginia]] | area = [[Princeton, West Virginia]]
[[Bluefield, Virginia]]
[[Bluefield, West Virginia]] | branding = ''Eagle 100.1 & 100.9 FM'' | slogan = "The Classic Rock Station" | airdate = [[1983 in radio|1983]] | frequency = 100.9 [[Megahertz|MHz]] | format = [[Classic rock]] | erp = 340 [[watt]]s | haat = {{convert|409|m|ft|sp=us}} | class = A | facility_id = 44002 | coordinates = {{coord|37|15|5.0|N|81|11|20.0|W|type:landmark}} | callsign_meaning = | former_callsigns = | owner = [[Triad Broadcasting]] Company, LLC | licensee = Monterey Licenses, LLC | sister_stations = [[WBDY]], [[WHAJ]], [[WHIS]], [[WHKX]], [[WHKX|WHQX]], [[WKEZ (AM)|WKEZ]], WKOY, [[WHIS|WTZE]] | webcast = | website = [http://www.theeaglefm.com/ theeaglefm.com] | affiliations = [[John Boy and Billy]] }} '''WKOY-FM''' is an American [[classic rock]] formatted [[Broadcasting|broadcast]] [[radio station]] licensed to [[Princeton, West Virginia]], serving [[Princeton, West Virginia]], [[Bluefield, Virginia]] and [[Bluefield, West Virginia]]. WKOY-FM is owned and operated by [[Triad Broadcasting]] Company, LLC ==External links== * [http://www.theeaglefm.com/ Eagle 100.1 & 100.9 FM Online] * {{FM station data|WKOY}} {{SouthwestVA Radio}} {{Bluefield Radio}} {{Classic Rock Radio Stations in West Virginia}} {{Triad Broadcasting}} [[Category:Radio stations in West Virginia|KOY-FM]] [[Category:Virginia Tech Radio Network|KOY-FM]] [[Category:Classic rock radio stations in the United States]] {{WestVirginia-radio-station-stub}}
